item.title: Indiana completes undefeated season and wins first national title, beating Miami
item.description: Indiana bullied its way into the history books Monday night, toppling Miami 27-21 to put the finishing touch on a rags-to-riches story, an undefeated season and the national title.

item.title: Top U.S. archbishops denounce American foreign policy
item.description: The three most-senior cardinals leading U.S. archdioceses issued the rebuke in a joint statement on Monday, saying recent policies have thrown America's "morale role in confronting evil" into question.

item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum quelled concerns on Monday about two recent movements of the U.S. military in the vicinity of Mexico that have the country on edge since the attack on Venezuela.

item.description: "Considering your Country decided not to give me the Nobel Peace Prize… I no longer feel an obligation to think purely of Peace," Trump wrote in a message to the Norwegian Prime Minister.

item.title: U.S. lawmakers wrap reassurance tour in Denmark as tensions around Greenland grow
item.description: A bipartisan congressional delegation traveled to Denmark to try to deescalate rising tensions. Just as they were finishing, President Trump announced new tariffs on the country until it agrees to his plan of acquiring Greenland.

item.title: Can exercise and anti-inflammatories fend off aging? A study aims to find out
item.description: New research is underway to test whether a combination of high-intensity interval training and generic medicines can slow down aging and fend off age-related diseases. Here's how it might work.

item.title: Death toll in Spanish high-speed train collision rises to 40
item.description: The high-speed rail collision in southern Spain happened Sunday when the tail end of a train jumped the track, causing another train to derail. Authorities say the impact was so violent that bodies were found hundreds of meters away.
